document.discussion_title: Coders, lifestyle developer startup accelerator launches
document.topic_text: Business Coders, lifestyle developer startup accelerator launches A full room watches as six Knoxville based software startups present their products during CodeWorks Demo Day at the Southern Railway Station on Thursday, December 17, 2015. (SAUL YOUNG/NEWS SENTINEL) 2:10 p.m. 2:10 p.m. 0 The Knoxville Entrepreneur Center and Scripps Networks Interactive are launching The Works, which is a startup accelerator for coders and lifestyle content developers. The Works will combine MediaWorks and CodeWorks, which are two programs the Entrepreneur Center already has underway. Scripps Networks will provide its video content creation capabilities. The program will consist of 12 weeks of classes, mentoring, coworking opportunities and other assistance for eight startup businesses chosen. Applications for The Works are now open and will close May 15. Applications and more information is at www.theworks2016.com. The program will launch in early June. About Ed Marcum
